title: How to Use Binder Clips As a Shelf Organizer

steps.headline: Select the number of clips that correspond to the number of shelves.
steps.description: Each shelf will be labeled with a binder clip (or possibly two depending upon the size of the shelves) so make sure you have enough and a size that will clip easily to the edge of the shelf.

steps.headline: Label each clip.
steps.description:
You will need to identify what is on the shelf for easy and quick access. Determine how you would like to label the clip (i.e. terminology such as “paper” or “folders” etc.) and then choose a printing method. Handwritten: Simply apply a pen to each label for quick labeling. Be sure your handwriting is legible especially if others will be using the shelves. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/06\/Make-Binder-Clips-As-a-Shelf-Organizer-Step-2Bullet1-Version-2.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Binder-Clips-As-a-Shelf-Organizer-Step-2Bullet1-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/06\/Make-Binder-Clips-As-a-Shelf-Organizer-Step-2Bullet1-Version-2.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-Binder-Clips-As-a-Shelf-Organizer-Step-2Bullet1-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Inkjet printer: Select the label size on your print software and then create your labels by typing each name in the provided box. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cf\/Make-Binder-Clips-As-a-Shelf-Organizer-Step-2Bullet2-Version-2.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Binder-Clips-As-a-Shelf-Organizer-Step-2Bullet2-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cf\/Make-Binder-Clips-As-a-Shelf-Organizer-Step-2Bullet2-Version-2.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-Binder-Clips-As-a-Shelf-Organizer-Step-2Bullet2-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Place the labels on the back of each binder clip.
steps.description: Peel adhesive label from the label sheet and apply to the back of the binder.

steps.headline: Clip the binder clip to the end of each shelf.
steps.description: Make sure the label is visible and clip ends are flush against the bottom of the shelf.

text:
Select the number of clips that correspond to the number of shelves. Each shelf will be labeled with a binder clip (or possibly two depending upon the size of the shelves) so make sure you have enough and a size that will clip easily to the edge of the shelf. Label each clip. You will need to identify what is on the shelf for easy and quick access. Determine how you would like to label the clip (i.e. terminology such as “paper” or “folders” etc.) and then choose a printing method. Handwritten: Simply apply a pen to each label for quick labeling. Be sure your handwriting is legible especially if others will be using the shelves. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/06\/Make-Binder-Clips-As-a-Shelf-Organizer-Step-2Bullet1-Version-2.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Binder-Clips-As-a-Shelf-Organizer-Step-2Bullet1-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/0\/06\/Make-Binder-Clips-As-a-Shelf-Organizer-Step-2Bullet1-Version-2.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-Binder-Clips-As-a-Shelf-Organizer-Step-2Bullet1-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Inkjet printer: Select the label size on your print software and then create your labels by typing each name in the provided box. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cf\/Make-Binder-Clips-As-a-Shelf-Organizer-Step-2Bullet2-Version-2.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Binder-Clips-As-a-Shelf-Organizer-Step-2Bullet2-Version-2.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/c\/cf\/Make-Binder-Clips-As-a-Shelf-Organizer-Step-2Bullet2-Version-2.jpg\/v4-759px-Make-Binder-Clips-As-a-Shelf-Organizer-Step-2Bullet2-Version-2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Place the labels on the back of each binder clip. Peel adhesive label from the label sheet and apply to the back of the binder. Clip the binder clip to the end of each shelf. Make sure the label is visible and clip ends are flush against the bottom of the shelf. Finished.
